form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: RECORD OF SWORN STATEMENT IN AFFIDAVIT, I-215A

full_text: Screened by NARA, 6/29/2023 Form I-215A (Rev. 4-1-62) UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE RECORD OF SWORN STATEMENT IN AFFIDAVIT FORM AFFIDAVIT IN RE: CORRALES-Mesa, Luis FILE NO. EXECUTED AT Carlsbad, New Mexico DATE September 9, 1964 Before the following officer of the U. S. Immigration and Naturalization Service: Robert J. Stille, Immigration Patrol Inspector Luis CORRALES Mesa I, , acknowledge that the above-named officer has identified himself to me as an officer of the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service authorized by law to administer oaths and take testimony in connection with the enforcement of the Immigration and Nationality laws of the United States. I am willing to make a sworn statement before him in the above-named case. I understand that any statement which I make must be freely and voluntarily given and that it may be used by the Government as evidence in any proceedings against me or any other person. Being duly sworn, I make the following statement freely and voluntarily: My real name is Luis CORRALES Mesa. I have never used any other name. I am a citizen of Mexico. I was born in Ciudad Chihuahua, Chihuhua, Mexico on January 11, 1907. I live at calle Smaniego, number 223, Ciudad Chihuahua, Chihuahua, Mexico. My wife is Ausucion LERMA. She was born in Parral, Chihuahua, Mexico. We have two children. They were born born in Chihuahua, My father and mother are dead. My father was called Luis CORRALES Montes. He was born in Chihuahua, Shihuahua, Mexico. My mother was Angela MESA Garcia. She Was also born in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, Mexico. My father entered through the immigration many years ago and paid eight pesos. He worked here about ten years and returned to Mexico. My mother never lived here in the United States. I have never been caught by the immigration before. I was contracted as a bracero from '52 to 162. I have no criminal record. I last entered the United States through the river on foot about a half mile downriver from the bridge at Ysleta, Texas. I entered on about July 2, 1964 at about three in the morning. I was not inspected by the immigration nor did I have any immigration papers. I caught a bus from El Paso to Carlsbad. I hid the night on the river bank in Carlsbad and then caught another bus to Artesia. I have been working for R.C. Clack on his farm. I intended to return to Mexico in December. I certify the foregoing has been read to me in the Spanish language and is true and correct. Lui Dorrales Sworn and subscribed to before me this September 9, 1964 at Carlsbad, New Mexico.
